senses.de: To help something to happen, develop, or increase
senses.ex: The government has introduced new measures to promote economic growth.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Using 'promote' in this context usually implies something beneficial is being supported.
Tips.example: Their programs promote healthy eating in schools.

Tips.title: Abstract Concepts
Tips.description: 'Promote' is often used with ideas or principles, not just tangible items.
Tips.example: The event aims to promote peace and goodwill.

Tips.title: Action Required
Tips.description: 'Promote' implies an active effort or strategy, not just passive support.
Tips.example: We should promote discussion on this important issue.

senses.de: To raise someone to a higher or more important position or rank
senses.ex: She was promoted to senior manager just two years after joining the company.

Tips.title: Career Advancement
Tips.description: 'Promote' often signifies a career progression, usually with more responsibilities.
Tips.example: After leading the project, Joane was promoted.

Tips.title: Recognition of Merit
Tips.description: A promotion usually means recognition of someone's hard work or talent.
Tips.example: His skills in negotiation led to his promotion.

senses.de: To encourage people to buy or use a product or service by advertising or other means
senses.ex: The company is promoting its new line of skincare products.

Tips.title: Marketing Strategy
Tips.description: 'Promote' involves strategies to make a product appealing to potential customers.
Tips.example: The store is promoting its products with a big sale.

Tips.title: Persuasion Involved
Tips.description: Promoting in marketing aims to persuade people to be interested in what's offered.
Tips.example: Influencers promote brands to their followers.

senses.de: To suggest someone for a job or position
senses.ex: The department head promoted him for the vacant managerial position.

Tips.title: Support for Others
Tips.description: Suggesting someone for a position shows support and confidence in their abilities.
Tips.example: I will promote you for the lead role in this project.

senses.de: To work actively for a purpose or cause
senses.ex: The NGO promotes the rights and welfare of children worldwide.

Tips.title: Advocacy Element
Tips.description: 'Promote' may involve campaigning or advocating for a cause you are passionate about.

Advance.wordDefinition:
Advance means to move forward or make progress, often in terms of career or education.

Advance is applicable in situations where someone is trying to progress their career or education, while promote is applicable in situations where someone is trying to gain support or increase awareness of something.

Advertise.wordDefinition:
Advertise and promote are both words that refer to promoting something, but there is a slight difference between them. Advertising means to pay for a space in a public area to promote something, such as buying ad space on a billboard or website.

So, while advertising is a specific way of promoting, promoting encompasses a wider range of techniques to get a message out.

Boost.wordDefinition:
Both the words boost and promote mean to increase or improve something.

However, boost usually refers to increasing something quickly, like getting a quick burst of energy or making something grow rapidly, while promote refers to a gradual and sustained effort to draw attention to something, such as promoting a product or a cause over a longer period of time.

For example, a new energy drink might be advertised as being able to boost your energy levels quickly, while a charity might promote their cause through a series of campaigns and events over a longer period of time.

Boost is used for short-term effects, while promote is used for a long-term result.

Elevate.wordDefinition:
Elevate means to raise something higher, both physically and metaphorically. It could refer to physically lifting something up high or elevating someone to a higher position or status.

Elevate means to physically or metaphorically raise something higher, while promote means to advertise or support something or someone to help them succeed.

Elevating is more about lifting up, while promoting is more about advocating for someone or something.

Encourage.wordDefinition:
Encourage means to give support, confidence, or hope to someone. For example, if your friend is feeling down about their grades, you can encourage them to keep studying and not give up.

Encourage is used to give someone a boost or motivation, while promote is used to increase awareness or popularity of something.

Enhance.wordDefinition:
Enhance means to improve or increase the quality or value of something.

It is used when you want to make something better than it was before. For example, you can enhance your skills by practicing regularly or enhance the flavor of a dish by adding spices.

Enhance means to make something better, while promote means to make more people aware of something and support its growth.

Forward.wordDefinition:
Forward means to move something in the direction to which it is facing. For example, you can say "I will forward this email to my friend".

Forward refers to movement, while promote refers to advertisement or advancement.

Improve.wordDefinition:
Improve means to make something better. For example, you can improve your grades by studying harder or you can improve your health by eating more fruits and vegetables.

The main difference between the two words is that improve focuses on making something better, while promote focuses on supporting and encouraging the growth or development of something.

Both words can be applicable in various situations. Improve is more commonly used in personal and individual situations where you want to make something better, while promote is more commonly used in professional and organizational situations where you want to support the growth and development of something.

Stimulate.wordDefinition:
Stimulate means to encourage activity or growth in a particular area. For example, a scientist might use a chemical to stimulate the growth of cells in a laboratory.

Both words are applicable in situations where you want to encourage something to happen or grow, but promote is more focused on awareness or behavior, while stimulate is more focused on activity or growth.

quotes.Text: When you're making a movie, you don't think about the outcome. That's something I'm grateful for: whenever I go and do a new project, I never think about the outcome. It's always just about the work at hand. That's the fun part. The other part is always something I've had a struggle with, which is promoting the film. I know it's important.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Robert Redford

quotes.Text: I would try to promote something that I loved, and the entire interview would be about my personal life. I would leave a room feeling defeated, feeling embarrassed, but I would always make sure to put that smile on my face because I wasn't going to let them get to me.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Selena Gomez

quotes.Text: I like to believe that people in the long run are going to do more to promote peace than our governments. Indeed, I think that people want peace so much that one of these days governments had better get out of the way and let them have it.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.Text: Buildings are 'humane' only when they promote peaceful human co-existence.

quotes.Name: Frei Otto

quotes.Text: I'm very camera shy, but I realise it's important to promote films.

quotes.Text: When your higher self is present, it always promotes peace.
